trans-unit.source: Site Recovery components
trans-unit.target: Site Recovery components

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of Site Recovery components and how to manage them
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of Site Recovery components and how to manage them

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines and physical servers.

trans-unit.source: Machines can be replicated to Azure, or to a secondary on-premises data center.
trans-unit.target: Machines can be replicated to Azure, or to a secondary on-premises data center.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Read an overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Read an overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article summarizes and describes the Site Recovery components that are installed on servers and virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This article summarizes and describes the Site Recovery components that are installed on servers and virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: You can post any questions about this article on the <linkText>Azure Recovery Services Forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can post any questions about this article on the <linkText>Azure Recovery Services Forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Site Recovery components will vary slightly depending on the protection scenario.
trans-unit.target: Site Recovery components will vary slightly depending on the protection scenario.

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required components
trans-unit.target: Required components

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: You deploy Azure Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines between two datacenters
trans-unit.target: You deploy Azure Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines between two datacenters

trans-unit.source:
Each datacenter has a VMM server

Each VMM server has a private cloud that contains one or more Hyper-V host servers with virtual machines you want to protect
trans-unit.target:
Each datacenter has a VMM server

Each VMM server has a private cloud that contains one or more Hyper-V host servers with virtual machines you want to protect

trans-unit.source: The Azure Site Recovery Provider will be installed on both VMM servers
trans-unit.target: The Azure Site Recovery Provider will be installed on both VMM servers

trans-unit.source:
No components are installed on the Hyper-V host servers or protected virtual machines

The Azure Site Recovery Provider on the VMM server communicates with the Site Recovery service over HTTPS 443 to orchestrate protection

Replication occurs between the primary and secondary Hyper-V host servers over the internet using Kerberos and certificate authentication on ports 8083 and 8084.
trans-unit.target:
No components are installed on the Hyper-V host servers or protected virtual machines

The Azure Site Recovery Provider on the VMM server communicates with the Site Recovery service over HTTPS 443 to orchestrate protection

Replication occurs between the primary and secondary Hyper-V host servers over the internet using Kerberos and certificate authentication on ports 8083 and 8084.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>On-premises to on-premises</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>On-premises to on-premises</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required components
trans-unit.target: Required components

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: You deploy Azure Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines between a datacenter and Azure
trans-unit.target: You deploy Azure Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines between a datacenter and Azure

trans-unit.source: The on-premises datacenter has a VMM server with a private cloud that contains one or more Hyper-V host servers with virtual machines you want to protect
trans-unit.target: The on-premises datacenter has a VMM server with a private cloud that contains one or more Hyper-V host servers with virtual machines you want to protect

trans-unit.source:
The Azure Site Recovery Provider will be installed on the VMM server

The Microsoft Recovery Services agent will be installed on source Hyper-V host servers
trans-unit.target:
The Azure Site Recovery Provider will be installed on the VMM server

The Microsoft Recovery Services agent will be installed on source Hyper-V host servers

trans-unit.source:
No components are installed on protected virtual machines

The Azure Site Recovery Provider on the VMM server communicates with the Site Recovery service over HTTPS 443 to orchestrate protection

Replication occurs between Microsoft Recovery Services agent running on the source Hyper-V host servers and Azure over HTTPS 443.
trans-unit.target:
No components are installed on protected virtual machines

The Azure Site Recovery Provider on the VMM server communicates with the Site Recovery service over HTTPS 443 to orchestrate protection

Replication occurs between Microsoft Recovery Services agent running on the source Hyper-V host servers and Azure over HTTPS 443.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>On-premises VMM to Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>On-premises VMM to Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required components
trans-unit.target: Required components

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: You deploy Azure Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines between a datacenter and Azure
trans-unit.target: You deploy Azure Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines between a datacenter and Azure

trans-unit.source:
The on-premises datacenter has one or more Hyper-V host servers with virtual machines you want to protect

During configuration you define a Hyper-V site that contains one or more of these Hyper-V host servers
trans-unit.target:
The on-premises datacenter has one or more Hyper-V host servers with virtual machines you want to protect

During configuration you define a Hyper-V site that contains one or more of these Hyper-V host servers

trans-unit.source: A single component installation runs to install both the Azure Site Recovery Provider and the Microsoft Recovery Services agent on the Hyper-V host servers
trans-unit.target: A single component installation runs to install both the Azure Site Recovery Provider and the Microsoft Recovery Services agent on the Hyper-V host servers

trans-unit.source:
No VMM server in the deployment

No components are installed on protected virtual machines

The Azure Site Recovery Provider on the Hyper-V host server communicates with the Site Recovery service over HTTPS 443 to orchestrate protection

Replication occurs between the Microsoft Recovery Services agent running on the Hyper-V host server and Azure over HTTPS 443.
trans-unit.target:
No VMM server in the deployment

No components are installed on protected virtual machines

The Azure Site Recovery Provider on the Hyper-V host server communicates with the Site Recovery service over HTTPS 443 to orchestrate protection

Replication occurs between the Microsoft Recovery Services agent running on the Hyper-V host server and Azure over HTTPS 443.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>On-premises VMM to Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>On-premises VMM to Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this scenario replication can happen in two ways:
trans-unit.target: In this scenario replication can happen in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Over a VPN connection (using Azure ExpressRoute or a site-to-site VPN)
trans-unit.target: Over a VPN connection (using Azure ExpressRoute or a site-to-site VPN)

trans-unit.source: Over a secure connection on the internet
trans-unit.target: Over a secure connection on the internet

trans-unit.source: Communications from on-premises servers are directed to internal ports on the Azure virtual network to which the configuration and master target virtual machines are connected.
trans-unit.target: Communications from on-premises servers are directed to internal ports on the Azure virtual network to which the configuration and master target virtual machines are connected.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VMware or physical machine to Azure over the internet </linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VMware or physical machine to Azure over the internet </linkText>

trans-unit.source: All communications from on-premises servers are directed to mapped public endpoints on the Azure cloud service for the configuration server virtual machine and master target server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: All communications from on-premises servers are directed to mapped public endpoints on the Azure cloud service for the configuration server virtual machine and master target server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The endpoints are dynamically created when you deploy the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The endpoints are dynamically created when you deploy the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VMware or physical machine to Azure over the internet </linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VMware or physical machine to Azure over the internet </linkText>

trans-unit.source: Component
trans-unit.target: Component

trans-unit.source: Port
trans-unit.target: Port

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Process server
trans-unit.target: Process server

trans-unit.source: Protected machines send data for replication to the process server over TCP 9080.
trans-unit.target: Protected machines send data for replication to the process server over TCP 9080.

trans-unit.source: Configuration server
trans-unit.target: Configuration server

trans-unit.source: HTTPS/443
trans-unit.target: HTTPS/443

trans-unit.source: The Mobility service running on protected machines sends replication metadata to the configuration server on port 443.
trans-unit.target: The Mobility service running on protected machines sends replication metadata to the configuration server on port 443.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS/443
trans-unit.target: HTTPS/443

trans-unit.source: The configuration server coordinates and orchestrates machine protection.
trans-unit.target: The configuration server coordinates and orchestrates machine protection.

trans-unit.source: The process server communicates with the configuration server on 443 or the mapped public endpoint to receive management and control information.
trans-unit.target: The process server communicates with the configuration server on 443 or the mapped public endpoint to receive management and control information.

trans-unit.source: In the failback direction, the vContinuum tool requests control and metadata from the configuration server on port 9443 (not shown on diagram)
trans-unit.target: In the failback direction, the vContinuum tool requests control and metadata from the configuration server on port 9443 (not shown on diagram)

trans-unit.source: Remote management with PowerShell uses port 5986 (not shown on diagram)
trans-unit.target: Remote management with PowerShell uses port 5986 (not shown on diagram)

trans-unit.source: RDP connection to the configuration server using 3389 (not shown on diagram)
trans-unit.target: RDP connection to the configuration server using 3389 (not shown on diagram)

trans-unit.source: Master target server
trans-unit.target: Master target server

trans-unit.source: The process site sends communications about replication traffic to the master target server over 9080
trans-unit.target: The process site sends communications about replication traffic to the master target server over 9080

trans-unit.source: HTTP/443
trans-unit.target: HTTP/443

trans-unit.source: The process server replicates data to the master target server over HTTP or 443 (VPN)
trans-unit.target: The process server replicates data to the master target server over HTTP or 443 (VPN)

trans-unit.source: HTTP/443
trans-unit.target: HTTP/443

trans-unit.source: The process server replicates data to the master target server over HTTP or 443 (VPN)
trans-unit.target: The process server replicates data to the master target server over HTTP or 443 (VPN)

trans-unit.source: Firewall rules
trans-unit.target: Firewall rules

trans-unit.source:
For push installation of the Mobility service to work correctly the firewall on protected machines should allow File and Printer Sharing and Windows Management Instrumentation.

The firewall rules on machines you want to protect should allow them to reach the configuration server.

To connect to Azure virtual machines over the internet after failover, firewall rules on the machines should allow Remote Desktop connections over the internet. To connect to a failed over Linux machine in Azure the Secure Shell service should be set to start automatically on system, and firewall rules should allow an ssh connection.
trans-unit.target:
For push installation of the Mobility service to work correctly the firewall on protected machines should allow File and Printer Sharing and Windows Management Instrumentation.

The firewall rules on machines you want to protect should allow them to reach the configuration server.

To connect to Azure virtual machines over the internet after failover, firewall rules on the machines should allow Remote Desktop connections over the internet. To connect to a failed over Linux machine in Azure the Secure Shell service should be set to start automatically on system, and firewall rules should allow an ssh connection.

trans-unit.source: Component
trans-unit.target: Component

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: Installation

trans-unit.source: Deployment scenario
trans-unit.target: Deployment scenario

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery Provider for VMM
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery Provider for VMM

trans-unit.source: Handles communication between the VMM server and the Site Recovery service.
trans-unit.target: Handles communication between the VMM server and the Site Recovery service.

trans-unit.source: Installed on a VMM server
trans-unit.target: Installed on a VMM server

trans-unit.source: Used when you set up protection between two VMM sites or between a VMM site and Azure
trans-unit.target: Used when you set up protection between two VMM sites or between a VMM site and Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery Provider for Hyper-V
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery Provider for Hyper-V

trans-unit.source: Handles communication between the Hyper-V host and the Site Recovery service when VMM isn't deployed.
trans-unit.target: Handles communication between the Hyper-V host and the Site Recovery service when VMM isn't deployed.

trans-unit.source: Installed on a Hyper-V host server
trans-unit.target: Installed on a Hyper-V host server

trans-unit.source: Used when you set up protection between a Hyper-V site and Azure.
trans-unit.target: Used when you set up protection between a Hyper-V site and Azure.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Recovery Services Agent
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Recovery Services Agent

trans-unit.source: Handles communication between the Hyper-V host server and the Site Recovery service
trans-unit.target: Handles communication between the Hyper-V host server and the Site Recovery service

trans-unit.source: Installed on the Hyper-V host server
trans-unit.target: Installed on the Hyper-V host server

trans-unit.source:
Used when you set up protection between a Hyper-V site and Azure.

You download a single provider that includes both the Azure Site Recovery Provider for Hyper-V and the Microsoft Recovery Services Agent.
trans-unit.target:
Used when you set up protection between a Hyper-V site and Azure.

You download a single provider that includes both the Azure Site Recovery Provider for Hyper-V and the Microsoft Recovery Services Agent.

trans-unit.source: Process server/Failback process server
trans-unit.target: Process server/Failback process server

trans-unit.source:
Optimizes data from protected VMware machines or Windows/Linux physical server before sending it to the master target server in Azure

Does push installation of the Mobility Service on VMware virtual machines or physical servers

Performs automatic discovery of VMware virtual machines.

Failback process server: Only the first point on optimizing data before replication is applicable for the failback process server
trans-unit.target:
Optimizes data from protected VMware machines or Windows/Linux physical server before sending it to the master target server in Azure

Does push installation of the Mobility Service on VMware virtual machines or physical servers

Performs automatic discovery of VMware virtual machines.

Failback process server: Only the first point on optimizing data before replication is applicable for the failback process server

trans-unit.source:
Installed on a on-premises server running at least Windows Server 2012 R2

Failback process server: Runs on a standard A4 size Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target:
Installed on a on-premises server running at least Windows Server 2012 R2

Failback process server: Runs on a standard A4 size Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source:
Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.

Failback process server: Used for failback from Azure to on-premises
trans-unit.target:
Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.

Failback process server: Used for failback from Azure to on-premises

trans-unit.source: Mobility service
trans-unit.target: Mobility service

trans-unit.source: Captures changes on protected machines and communicates them to the on-premises process server for replication to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Captures changes on protected machines and communicates them to the on-premises process server for replication to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Installed on on-premises VMware virtual machines or on physical servers that you want to protect
trans-unit.target: Installed on on-premises VMware virtual machines or on physical servers that you want to protect

trans-unit.source: Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.
trans-unit.target: Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.

trans-unit.source: Master target server/failback master target server
trans-unit.target: Master target server/failback master target server

trans-unit.source:
Holds replicated data from your protected machines using attached VHDs created on blob storage in your Azure storage account

Failback master target server: Holds replication data from failed over virtual machines in Azure. Data is held on VMDKs created in the data store that's selected when reverse replication is enabled for failback.
trans-unit.target:
Holds replicated data from your protected machines using attached VHDs created on blob storage in your Azure storage account

Failback master target server: Holds replication data from failed over virtual machines in Azure. Data is held on VMDKs created in the data store that's selected when reverse replication is enabled for failback.

trans-unit.source:
Installed as an Azure virtual machine as a Windows server based on a Windows Server 2012 R2 gallery image (to protect Windows machines) or as a Linux server based on a OpenLogic CentOS 6.6 gallery image (to protect Linux machines)

Two sizing options are available – standard A3 and standard D14

Failback master target server: Runs on a VMware virtual machine. It's provisioned on the same host to which the machine will be failed back.
trans-unit.target:
Installed as an Azure virtual machine as a Windows server based on a Windows Server 2012 R2 gallery image (to protect Windows machines) or as a Linux server based on a OpenLogic CentOS 6.6 gallery image (to protect Linux machines)

Two sizing options are available – standard A3 and standard D14

Failback master target server: Runs on a VMware virtual machine. It's provisioned on the same host to which the machine will be failed back.

trans-unit.source:
Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.

Failback master target server: Used for failback of failed over virtual from Azure back to on-premises.
trans-unit.target:
Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.

Failback master target server: Used for failback of failed over virtual from Azure back to on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Configuration server
trans-unit.target: Configuration server

trans-unit.source:
Coordinates communication between protected machines, the process server, and master target servers in Azure

Sets up replication and coordinates recovery in Azure when failover occurs
trans-unit.target:
Coordinates communication between protected machines, the process server, and master target servers in Azure

Sets up replication and coordinates recovery in Azure when failover occurs

trans-unit.source: Installed on an Azure Standard A3 virtual machine in the same Azure subscription as Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: Installed on an Azure Standard A3 virtual machine in the same Azure subscription as Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.
trans-unit.target: Used when you set up protection between an on-premises physical server or VMware virtual machines, and Azure.

trans-unit.source: The Provider runs on your VMM servers, Hyper-V host servers if you don't have a VMM server in your deployment, or on a configuration server.
trans-unit.target: The Provider runs on your VMM servers, Hyper-V host servers if you don't have a VMM server in your deployment, or on a configuration server.

trans-unit.source: It connects to the Site Recovery service over the internet with an encrypted HTTPS connection.
trans-unit.target: It connects to the Site Recovery service over the internet with an encrypted HTTPS connection.

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: You don't need to add specific firewall exception to connect the Provider to Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to add specific firewall exception to connect the Provider to Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: If you want the server on which the provider runs to connect to the internet using a proxy server you can either use the existing proxy settings, or specify a custom proxy.
trans-unit.target: If you want the server on which the provider runs to connect to the internet using a proxy server you can either use the existing proxy settings, or specify a custom proxy.

trans-unit.source: The proxy needs to allow these addresses through the firewall:
trans-unit.target: The proxy needs to allow these addresses through the firewall:

trans-unit.source: *.accesscontrol.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.accesscontrol.windows.net

trans-unit.source: .backup.windowsazure.com
trans-unit.target: .backup.windowsazure.com

trans-unit.source: *.blob.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.blob.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: *.store.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: *.store.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: If you have IP address-based rules on your firewall make sure they allow communication from the configuration server to IP addresses described in <linkText>Azure Datacenter IP ranges</linkText><title></title> and for HTTPS (443).
trans-unit.target: If you have IP address-based rules on your firewall make sure they allow communication from the configuration server to IP addresses described in <linkText>Azure Datacenter IP ranges</linkText><title></title> and for HTTPS (443).

trans-unit.source: You'll need to whitelist IP address ranges of the Azure region you plan to use and for West US.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to whitelist IP address ranges of the Azure region you plan to use and for West US.

trans-unit.source: If you're deploying Site Recovery with VMM and you use a custom proxy, a VMM RunAs account (DRAProxyAccount) will be created automatically using the proxy credentials you specify in the custom proxy settings in the Site Recovery portal.
trans-unit.target: If you're deploying Site Recovery with VMM and you use a custom proxy, a VMM RunAs account (DRAProxyAccount) will be created automatically using the proxy credentials you specify in the custom proxy settings in the Site Recovery portal.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to set up the proxy server so that this account can authenticate successfully.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to set up the proxy server so that this account can authenticate successfully.

trans-unit.source: If you're using a proxy traffic sent from the provider installed on a Hyper-V host server to the proxy must be sent over HTTP.
trans-unit.target: If you're using a proxy traffic sent from the provider installed on a Hyper-V host server to the proxy must be sent over HTTP.

trans-unit.source: The agent connects to the Site Recovery service over the internet with an encrypted HTTPS connection.
trans-unit.target: The agent connects to the Site Recovery service over the internet with an encrypted HTTPS connection.

trans-unit.source: No specify firewall exceptions are required.
trans-unit.target: No specify firewall exceptions are required.

trans-unit.source: The master target server can e Azure standard A4 or D14 virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The master target server can e Azure standard A4 or D14 virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: With a standard A4 master target you can add 16 data disks (maximum of 1023 GB per data disk) to each virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: With a standard A4 master target you can add 16 data disks (maximum of 1023 GB per data disk) to each virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: With a standard D14 master target you can add 32 data disks (maximum of 1023 GB per data disk) to each virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: With a standard D14 master target you can add 32 data disks (maximum of 1023 GB per data disk) to each virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: A standard D14 sized master target server is required only if you wish to protect a server that has more than 15 disks attached to it; for all other configurations you can deploy standard A4 sized master target servers.
trans-unit.target: A standard D14 sized master target server is required only if you wish to protect a server that has more than 15 disks attached to it; for all other configurations you can deploy standard A4 sized master target servers.

trans-unit.source: Note that one disk attached to the master target server is reserved as a retention drive.
trans-unit.target: Note that one disk attached to the master target server is reserved as a retention drive.

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery allows you to define retention windows and recover protected machines to a recovery point within that window.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery allows you to define retention windows and recover protected machines to a recovery point within that window.

trans-unit.source: The retention drive maintains a journal of disk changes for the duration of the window.
trans-unit.target: The retention drive maintains a journal of disk changes for the duration of the window.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the maximum disks available for replication on an A4 to 15 and on a D14 to 31.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the maximum disks available for replication on an A4 to 15 and on a D14 to 31.

trans-unit.source: The process server uses disk based cache.
trans-unit.target: The process server uses disk based cache.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that there's enough free space C:/ for the cache.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that there's enough free space C:/ for the cache.

trans-unit.source: Cache sizing will be affected by the data change rate of the machines you're protecting.
trans-unit.target: Cache sizing will be affected by the data change rate of the machines you're protecting.

trans-unit.source: Generally we recommend a cache directory size of 600 GB for medium size deployments.
trans-unit.target: Generally we recommend a cache directory size of 600 GB for medium size deployments.

trans-unit.source: You should deploy an additional process server if the data change rate of protected machines exceeds the capacity of an existing process server.
trans-unit.target: You should deploy an additional process server if the data change rate of protected machines exceeds the capacity of an existing process server.

trans-unit.source: To scale your deployment you add multiple process servers and master target servers.
trans-unit.target: To scale your deployment you add multiple process servers and master target servers.

trans-unit.source: You should deploy a second master target server if you don't have enough free disks on an existing master target server.
trans-unit.target: You should deploy a second master target server if you don't have enough free disks on an existing master target server.

trans-unit.source: Note that process servers and master target servers don't require one-to-one mapping.
trans-unit.target: Note that process servers and master target servers don't require one-to-one mapping.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy the first process server with the second master target server and so on.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy the first process server with the second master target server and so on.

trans-unit.source: The configuration server is a standard A3 virtual machine based on an Azure Site Recovery Windows Server 2012 R2 gallery image will be created in your subscription for the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: The configuration server is a standard A3 virtual machine based on an Azure Site Recovery Windows Server 2012 R2 gallery image will be created in your subscription for the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: It's created as the first instance in a new cloud service with a reserved public IP address.
trans-unit.target: It's created as the first instance in a new cloud service with a reserved public IP address.

trans-unit.source: Installation path in English characters only.
trans-unit.target: Installation path in English characters only.

trans-unit.source: Install on VMware virtual machines or physical servers.
trans-unit.target: Install on VMware virtual machines or physical servers.

trans-unit.source: Machines and servers must comply with the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: Machines and servers must comply with the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: Windows servers:
trans-unit.target: Windows servers:

trans-unit.source: 64-bit operating system: Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, or Windows Server 2008 R2 with at least SP1.
trans-unit.target: 64-bit operating system: Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, or Windows Server 2008 R2 with at least SP1.

trans-unit.source: Host name, mount points, device names, Windows system path (eg: C:\Windows) in English only.
trans-unit.target: Host name, mount points, device names, Windows system path (eg: C:\Windows) in English only.

trans-unit.source: The operating system on C:\ drive.
trans-unit.target: The operating system on C:\ drive.

trans-unit.source: Only basic disks are supported.
trans-unit.target: Only basic disks are supported.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic disks aren't supported.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic disks aren't supported.

trans-unit.source: Linux servers:
trans-unit.target: Linux servers:

trans-unit.source: A supported 64 bit operating system: Centos 6.4, 6.5, 6.6; Oracle Enterprise Linux 6.4, 6.5 running either the Red Hat compatible kernel or Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel Release 3 (UEK3), SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 SP3.
trans-unit.target: A supported 64 bit operating system: Centos 6.4, 6.5, 6.6; Oracle Enterprise Linux 6.4, 6.5 running either the Red Hat compatible kernel or Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel Release 3 (UEK3), SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 SP3.

trans-unit.source: /etc/hosts files on protected machines should contain entries that map the local host name to IP addresses associated with all NICs.
trans-unit.target: /etc/hosts files on protected machines should contain entries that map the local host name to IP addresses associated with all NICs.

trans-unit.source: Host name, mount points, device names, and Linux system paths and file names (eg /etc/; /usr) in English only.
trans-unit.target: Host name, mount points, device names, and Linux system paths and file names (eg /etc/; /usr) in English only.

trans-unit.source: Following storage supported: File system: EXT3, ETX4, ReiserFS, XFS/Multipath software-Device Mapper (multipath)/Volume manager: LVM2\.
trans-unit.target: Following storage supported: File system: EXT3, ETX4, ReiserFS, XFS/Multipath software-Device Mapper (multipath)/Volume manager: LVM2\.

trans-unit.source: Physical servers with HP CCISS controller storage aren't supported.
trans-unit.target: Physical servers with HP CCISS controller storage aren't supported.

trans-unit.source: For detailed planning information about these components read the capacity planning section in <linkText>this article</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed planning information about these components read the capacity planning section in <linkText>this article</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Component
trans-unit.target: Component

trans-unit.source: How to update
trans-unit.target: How to update

trans-unit.source:
Azure Site Recovery Provider for VMM

Azure Recovery Services Agent
trans-unit.target:
Azure Site Recovery Provider for VMM

Azure Recovery Services Agent

trans-unit.source:
First time installation: download the latest version from the Quick Start page

Ongoing: You can download the latest (and previous) versions from the Dashboard in Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target:
First time installation: download the latest version from the Quick Start page

Ongoing: You can download the latest (and previous) versions from the Dashboard in Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively if you opt in for Microsoft Updates the latest version of the Provider and agent will be installed automatically on the server.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively if you opt in for Microsoft Updates the latest version of the Provider and agent will be installed automatically on the server.

trans-unit.source:
Process server

Configuration server

Master target server
trans-unit.target:
Process server

Configuration server

Master target server

trans-unit.source: Check for updates on the Site Recovery Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Check for updates on the Site Recovery Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Mobility service
trans-unit.target: Mobility service

trans-unit.source:
Ensure you have the latest Mobility service updates on each machine you want to protect:

You can download the latest updates:

[Windows](http://download.microsoft.com/download/7/C/7/7C70CA53-2D8E-4FE0-BD85-8F7A7A8FA163/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0WindowsGA03Jul2015release.exe)

[RHELP6-64](http://download.microsoft.com/download/B/4/5/B45D1C8A-C287-4339-B60A-70F2C7EB6CFE/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0RHEL6-64GA03Jul2015release.tar.gz)

[OL6-64](http://download.microsoft.com/download/9/4/8/948A2D75-FC47-4DED-B2D7-DA4E28B9E339/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0OL6-64GA03Jul2015release.tar.gz)

[SLES11-SP3-64](http://download.microsoft.com/download/6/A/2/6A22BFCD-E978-41C5-957E-DACEBD43B353/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0SLES11-SP3-64GA03Jul2015release.tar.gz)

Alternatively after ensuring that the process server is up-to-date you can download the latest version of Mobility service from the C:\pushinstallsvc\repository folder on the process server
trans-unit.target:
Ensure you have the latest Mobility service updates on each machine you want to protect:

You can download the latest updates:

[Windows](http://download.microsoft.com/download/7/C/7/7C70CA53-2D8E-4FE0-BD85-8F7A7A8FA163/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0WindowsGA03Jul2015release.exe)

[RHELP6-64](http://download.microsoft.com/download/B/4/5/B45D1C8A-C287-4339-B60A-70F2C7EB6CFE/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0RHEL6-64GA03Jul2015release.tar.gz)

[OL6-64](http://download.microsoft.com/download/9/4/8/948A2D75-FC47-4DED-B2D7-DA4E28B9E339/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0OL6-64GA03Jul2015release.tar.gz)

[SLES11-SP3-64](http://download.microsoft.com/download/6/A/2/6A22BFCD-E978-41C5-957E-DACEBD43B353/Microsoft-ASRUA8.3.0.0SLES11-SP3-64GA03Jul2015release.tar.gz)

Alternatively after ensuring that the process server is up-to-date you can download the latest version of Mobility service from the C:\pushinstallsvc\repository folder on the process server

trans-unit.source: Start configuring the components for your deployment scenario.
trans-unit.target: Start configuring the components for your deployment scenario.
